original: chom rkun ma zhes bya ba ni aes brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: chom rkun ma zhes bya ba ni aes brgyan pa'o //
translated: The thief is adorned with e.

original: mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni wa'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni wa'o //
translated: The fourth of the end-stayers is va.

original: de nas pi tsu badzra ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas pi tsu badzra ldan pa'o //
translated: Then it is endowed with picu vajra.

original: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni ha'o //
analyzed: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni ha'o //
translated: The fourth of the uśanas is ha.

original: pu kka s'i ni zhes bya ba ni au dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pu kka s'i ni zhes bya ba ni au dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The of pukkasī is endowed with u.

original: stong pas mnan cing sum 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: stong pas mnan cing sum 'gyur nyid //
translated: It is pressed down with the void and tripled.

original: ces bya ba dang lnga pa'i gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni pha'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang lnga pa'i gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni pha'o //
translated: The second of the fifth is pha.

original: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
translated: The first of the third is ta.

original: mthar sv'a h'a ni kye'i rdo rje'i snying po'o //
analyzed: mthar sv'a h'a ni kye'i rdo rje'i snying po'o //
translated: At the end, svaha. This is the essence of Hevajra.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang por zhes bya ba ni aom dang por ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang por zhes bya ba ni aom dang por ro //
translated: The first Vairochana is the first oṃ.

original: dzva la dzva la dang lnga pa'i bzhi pa ni bha'o //
analyzed: dzva la dzva la dang lnga pa'i bzhi pa ni bha'o //
translated: The blazing, blazing is the fourth of the fifth, which is bha.

original: mthar gnas pa yi dang po zhes bya ba ni ya dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas pa yi dang po zhes bya ba ni ya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The first of the end-stayers is endowed with ya.

original: ghasmar'i ni aom ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ghasmar'i ni aom ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The of ghasmarī is oṃ, endowed with that.

original: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa ni ha'o //
analyzed: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa ni ha'o //
translated: The fourth of the uśanas is ha.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The of vajraḍākinī is endowed with u.

original: stong pa ni thig le dang lhan cig cing sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa ni thig le dang lhan cig cing sum 'gyur ro //
translated: The void is the bindu, and it is tripled.

original: lnga pa ni gnyis pa'i pha'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gnyis pa'i pha'o //
translated: The fifth is the father of the second.

original: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
translated: The first of the third is ta.

original: mthar sv'a h'a ni phyag bzhi pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mthar sv'a h'a ni phyag bzhi pa'i 'o //
translated: At the end, svaha. This is for the four-line homage.

original: dang por ni aom mo //
analyzed: dang por ni aom mo //
translated: First, it is om.

original: dang po'i dang por zhes bya ba ni ka'o //
analyzed: dang po'i dang por zhes bya ba ni ka'o //
translated: The first of the first is ka.

original: nang gi dkar mo zhes bya ba ni ae ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi dkar mo zhes bya ba ni ae ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The inner Pukkasi is e, and it is endowed with that.

original: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
translated: The first of the third is ta.

original: de yang ai 'dis brgyan pa ste gnyis ka yang nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ai 'dis brgyan pa ste gnyis ka yang nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: That is also adorned with this i. Both are doubled.

original: lnga pa'i gsum pa ni ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa'i gsum pa ni ba'o //
translated: The third of the fifth is va.

original: gnyis pa'i gsum pa ni dza ste ra dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i gsum pa ni dza ste ra dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The third of the second is ja, and it is endowed with ra.

original: mthar h'um gsum mo //
analyzed: mthar h'um gsum mo //
translated: At the end, there are three hūṃs.

original: lnga pa nyid kyi gnyis pa ni pha'o //
analyzed: lnga pa nyid kyi gnyis pa ni pha'o //
translated: The second of the fifth itself is pha.

original: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i dang po ni ta'o //
translated: The first of the third is ta.

original: mthar sv'a h'a ni phyag drug pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mthar sv'a h'a ni phyag drug pa'i 'o //
translated: At the end, svaha. This is for the six-line homage.

original: dang por rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba ni sngon du aom mo //
analyzed: dang por rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba ni sngon du aom mo //
translated: First, Vairocana is om at the beginning.

original: bzhi pa'i dang por ni ta'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i dang por ni ta'o //
translated: The first of the fourth is ta.

original: byin za ni re pha ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byin za ni re pha ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The hungry ghost is pha, and it is endowed with that.

original: ro langs ma ni ae ste @57a * //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni ae ste @57a * //
translated: The Vetāla is E.

original: de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with that.

original: mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa ni la'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas pa yi gsum pa ni la'o //
translated: The third of the final [places] is La.

original: ghasmar'i ni aom ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ghasmar'i ni aom ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Ghasmarī is Oṃ. It is endowed with that.

original: dang po'i dang po ni ka'o //
analyzed: dang po'i dang po ni ka'o //
translated: The first of the first [places] is Ka.

original: mthar gnas pa yi dang po ni ya ste de dang 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas pa yi dang po ni ya ste de dang 'dus pa'o //
translated: The first of the final [places] is Ya. It is combined with that.

original: rdo rje ma ni dbyangs kyi gnyis pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ma ni dbyangs kyi gnyis pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The Vajrī is the second vowel [i.e., i]. It is endowed with that.

original: ksha ni chom rkun ma yis zhes bya ba ni ae dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ksha ni chom rkun ma yis zhes bya ba ni ae dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The Kṣa is the one of the Ḍākinī. It is endowed with E.

original: lnga pa nyid kyi dang po ni pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa nyid kyi dang po ni pa'o //
translated: The first of the fifth [place] is Pa.

original: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa ni ha'o //
analyzed: au shma rnams kyi bzhi pa ni ha'o //
translated: The fourth of the Ūṣmaṇs is Ha.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au ste de dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au ste de dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The Vajradākinī is U. It is endowed with that.

original: stong pa ni thig le ste des mnan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa ni thig le ste des mnan pa'o //
translated: The void is the drop. It is placed on that.

original: sum 'gyur ni gsum du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sum 'gyur ni gsum du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The triple is the combination of three.

original: phat dang mthar sv'a h'a sngags 'di ni phyag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phat dang mthar sv'a h'a sngags 'di ni phyag gnyis pa'o //
translated: The mantra is PHAṬ at the end, and SVĀHĀ. This is the two-armed [form].

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni aa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni aa'o //
translated: The Nairātmyā is A.

original: dang po'i dang po ni ka'o //
analyzed: dang po'i dang po ni ka'o //
translated: The first of the first [places] is Ka.

original: de ltar sde tshan drug gi dang po'i yi ge drug go //
analyzed: de ltar sde tshan drug gi dang po'i yi ge drug go //
translated: Thus, the six letters of the first of the six classes.

original: dang por aom dang mthar sv'a h'a 'bum bzlas pas grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags kyis 'dod pa'i don byed do //
analyzed: dang por aom dang mthar sv'a h'a 'bum bzlas pas grong khyer dkrugs pa'i sngags kyis 'dod pa'i don byed do //
translated: By reciting Om at the beginning and Svaha at the end, one will accomplish one's desired aim with the mantra of the disturbance of the city.

original: dang por rnam par snang mdzad dang / ra ksha gnyis dang h'um gsum dang / phat dang lhag ma sv'a h'a ni sa sbyang ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: dang por rnam par snang mdzad dang / ra ksha gnyis dang h'um gsum dang / phat dang lhag ma sv'a h'a ni sa sbyang ba'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra for purifying the ground is Om Vairochana Raksha Raksha Hum Hum Phat, with Svaha at the end.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni aom ste dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni aom ste dang po'o //
translated: Vairochana is Om, which is at the beginning.

original: rdo rje ma ni a'a'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ma ni a'a'o //
translated: The a is Vajra Woman.

original: dbyangs kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni a'a: ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni a'a: ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The a at the end is the last of the vowels, which is aḥ, and it is endowed with that.

original: mthar h'um ni bza' ba dang btung ba byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: mthar h'um ni bza' ba dang btung ba byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags so //
translated: The hum at the end is the mantra for consecrating food and drink.

original: dang por rnam par snang mdzad ni sngon du aom mo //
analyzed: dang por rnam par snang mdzad ni sngon du aom mo //
translated: Vairochana is Om at the beginning.

original: aa k'a ro mu kham dang / au shma rnams kyi gsum pa ni sa'o //
analyzed: aa k'a ro mu kham dang / au shma rnams kyi gsum pa ni sa'o //
translated: The third of Akaro mukha and Ushma is sa.

original: mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa ni wa'o //
analyzed: mthar gnas pa yi bzhi pa ni wa'o //
translated: The fourth of the sthavara is va.

original: mgo bor ra yis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: mgo bor ra yis rnam par brgyan //
translated: It is adorned at the head with ra.

original: dharm'a n'i de ma thag tu rdo rje ma ni a'a'o //
analyzed: dharm'a n'i de ma thag tu rdo rje ma ni a'a'o //
translated: Immediately after dharani, a is Vajra Woman.

original: a'a dya nu tpa nna tv'a ta /
analyzed: a'a dya nu tpa nna tv'a ta /
translated: A dyanutpannatvata.

original: aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a mthar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um phat sv'a h'a mthar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā🔽🔽

original: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā is the mantra for the bali offering to all the bhūtas.

original: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las sngags btu ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las sngags btu ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter on the selection of mantras from the Koṭāliṅga, the difficult practice commentary composed by the learned master Śrī Durjayacandra.

original: // / sngags kyi le'u las btus pa'i sngags rnams kyis bya ba las kyi dbye ba las /
analyzed: // / sngags kyi le'u las btus pa'i sngags rnams kyis bya ba las kyi dbye ba las /
translated: The selection of mantras from the Mantra chapter, the division of activities,

original: phreng ba'i dbye ba dang / dam tshig gi dbye ba yang brjod par le'u bcu pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: phreng ba'i dbye ba dang / dam tshig gi dbye ba yang brjod par le'u bcu pa gsungs pa /
translated: the division of rosaries, and the division of commitments are taught in the tenth chapter.

original: bzlas pa'i yul ni rab phye ba //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i yul ni rab phye ba //
translated: The object of repetition is well distinguished.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so forth.

original: 'dis bzlas pa byed pa'i phyir bzlas pa ste phreng ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis bzlas pa byed pa'i phyir bzlas pa ste phreng ba'o //
translated: This is the rosary because it is used for the repetition.

original: de'i yul ni de'i skye gnas dang de 'byung ba'i gnas te shel la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni de'i skye gnas dang de 'byung ba'i gnas te shel la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its object is its source, its origin, such as crystal and so forth.

original: rengs par 'o ma'i btung ba nyid //
analyzed: rengs par 'o ma'i btung ba nyid //
translated: For immobilization, it is the drinking of milk.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang // bsad pa la @57b ni si hla nyid //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang // bsad pa la @57b ni si hla nyid //
translated: And so forth, and for killing, it is the bile.

original: ces bya ba ni nang gi bshad pa la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nang gi bshad pa la sogs pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth, the inner explanation, and so on.

original: mtha'i shva dang po'i shva //
analyzed: mtha'i shva dang po'i shva //
translated: The first śva of the end,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dam tshig lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dam tshig lnga'o //
translated: and so on, are the five outer pledges.

original: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: This concludes chapter ten of the commentary on the difficult points of the glorious Guhyasamāja called Illuminating the Hidden Meaning, composed by the learned master Durjayachandra.

original: // / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi rigs rtogs par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi rigs rtogs par bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs pa /
translated: Chapter eleven: The eleven chapters of the tantra are taught in order to understand the conventional lineage of the tathāgatas.

original: lus can rnams kyi rigs dang gzugs //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi rigs dang gzugs //
translated: The lineage and form of embodied beings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs ni rus te de bzhin gshegs pa che ge mo zhes bya ba'i rigs skye bo 'di la gang gis de gzugs su yod pa dang / nges par byed pa'i phyir de rigs kyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs ni rus te de bzhin gshegs pa che ge mo zhes bya ba'i rigs skye bo 'di la gang gis de gzugs su yod pa dang / nges par byed pa'i phyir de rigs kyi gzugs can no //
translated: and so on. Lineage is family. It is the family of a certain tathāgata, in which this person is born. Since it is the form of that, it is the form of the lineage.

original: gang dang gang gis mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis mtshan ma'am /
translated: By whatever sign or

original: kha dog gis de dang de'i rigs rtogs pa de lha'i sbyor bas sbyin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha dog gis de dang de'i rigs rtogs pa de lha'i sbyor bas sbyin pa'i phyir /
translated: color that lineage is understood, it is given by the application of the deity.

original: gang gi srin lag rtsa ba la //
analyzed: gang gi srin lag rtsa ba la //
translated: On whose finger-root

original: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa /
translated: becomes a nine-pointed vajra,

original: rnal 'byor pa gang nag po yin //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang nag po yin //
translated: that yogin is black.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: brtag pa dang po'i le'u bcu par gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtag pa dang po'i le'u bcu par gsungs pa /
translated: In the tenth chapter of the first part of the Compendium of Practice it says:

original: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid khu ba ldan gyur pa //
translated: As long as there is semen,

original: de srid phyag rgya brten par bya //
analyzed: de srid phyag rgya brten par bya //
translated: so long should one rely on a consort.

original: zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i grub pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i rim gro byed pa phyi dang nang la dga' ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes lhan cig skyes pa'i grub pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i rim gro byed pa phyi dang nang la dga' ba la sogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: It speaks of the outer and inner service of the perfect place of the innate, such as the joy of the consort.🔽In a forest, a place without people,

original: tshal dang skye bo med gnas dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshal dang skye bo med gnas dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: myos pas mtshan pa'i lag pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: myos pas mtshan pa'i lag pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: With a hand marked by intoxication.

original: myos pas mtshan pa ni tshang gi mtshan ma ste dal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: myos pas mtshan pa ni tshang gi mtshan ma ste dal ba med pa'o //
translated: Marked by intoxication is marked by the sign of intoxication, which is not slow.

original: de byed pa'i phyir chang gis mtshan pa'i lag pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa'i phyir chang gis mtshan pa'i lag pa'o //
translated: Because it does that, it is a hand marked by beer.

original: de brjod pa'i las kun gyis gsol ba btab pa'i phyag rgya la //
analyzed: de brjod pa'i las kun gyis gsol ba btab pa'i phyag rgya la //
translated: To the consort who is requested by all the actions that express that,

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i khyogs dang brla bskum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par 'jug pa rnams kyi las so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i khyogs dang brla bskum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag par 'jug pa rnams kyi las so //
translated: The actions of those who are engaged in the correct way by means of the palanquin, the bending of the thighs, and so on, which will be explained.

original: bya zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bya zhes bya ba ni dga' ba la rtsom pa'o //
translated: The word do means to begin with pleasure.

original: yang na myos par byed pa'i phyir myos byed do //
analyzed: yang na myos par byed pa'i phyir myos byed do //
translated: Or, intoxicant because it intoxicates.

original: rang rang gi gnas su mtshan par byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su mtshan par byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sign because it marks its own place.

original: 'od gsal bas lag pa lta bu ni 'od zer te dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'od gsal bas lag pa lta bu ni 'od zer te dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug go //
translated: The rays are like hands because of their radiance, the sixteen vowels.

original: de rnams kyi ji ltar gnas par bkod pas myos byed kyi mtshan mas mtshan pa'i lag pas te dbyangs kyis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ji ltar gnas par bkod pas myos byed kyi mtshan mas mtshan pa'i lag pas te dbyangs kyis so //
translated: By the arrangement of those in their own places, with the hand marked by the sign of the intoxicant, that is, with the vowels.

original: phyag rgya chen po la zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyag rgya la ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyag rgya la ste /
translated: On the great seal means on one's own seal.

original: myos byed 'byung ba'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: myos byed 'byung ba'i las byed pa'o //
translated: It performs the action of producing the intoxicant.

original: 'og dang steng dang byin pa dang brla dang / @58a * //
analyzed: 'og dang steng dang byin pa dang brla dang / @58a * //
translated: Below, above, on the thighs, and on the calves,

original: gsang ba dang mjug ma dang lte ba dang de'i steng du snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / rkan dang / zhal dang / sna dang / rna ba dang / dpral ba dang / ltag khung du'o //
analyzed: gsang ba dang mjug ma dang lte ba dang de'i steng du snying ga dang / lkog ma dang / rkan dang / zhal dang / sna dang / rna ba dang / dpral ba dang / ltag khung du'o //
translated: the throat, the palate, the face, the nose, the ears, the forehead, and the back of the neck.

original: ji ltar bya zhes snyam pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhes snyam pa la /
translated: How should one do it?

original: 'og dang steng du lta ba nyid //
analyzed: 'og dang steng du lta ba nyid //
translated: Looking up and down,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te phyogs gnyi ga yang 'gal ba med de 'di ni bla mas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te phyogs gnyi ga yang 'gal ba med de 'di ni bla mas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on. There is no contradiction in both positions, and this will be explained by the guru.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni gnyis so //
translated: The innate is twofold.

original: de'i don ni dgos pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don ni dgos pa ste lhan cig skyes pa'i don to //
translated: Its meaning is the purpose, the meaning of the innate.

original: de'i don gyi sbyor ba ni phyag rgya la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don gyi sbyor ba ni phyag rgya la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of that meaning is the application to the consort.

original: de brjod pa'i le'u ni lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa'i le'u ni lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that describes that is the chapter on the application of the meaning of the innate.

original: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter on the yoga of the meaning of the innate, from the commentary on the Koṭi composed by the learned master Śrī Durjayacandra.

original: // / dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i slob ma rnams la de kho na nyid bsgrags pa'i phyir dang / snod dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sngags kyi rjes su dbang gi le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i slob ma rnams la de kho na nyid bsgrags pa'i phyir dang / snod dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir sngags kyi rjes su dbang gi le'u gsungs pa /
translated: The chapter on empowerment is stated for the disciples who have entered the maṇḍala in order to proclaim reality to them and in order to make them suitable vessels.

original: de nas rdo rje can gyi dbang bzhi'i tshigs bcad bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dga' ba bzhi dang tha mi dad pa'i lus kyi dbang gi tshigs bcad bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje can gyi dbang bzhi'i tshigs bcad bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dga' ba bzhi dang tha mi dad pa'i lus kyi dbang gi tshigs bcad bzhi'o //
translated: Then, the four vajra empowerments were stated by Vajradhara. The four verses are the body of the four joys, which are not different.

original: de rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi po de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang aa na shya bha'i tshigs bcad kyis bsdus pa las bzhi po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi po de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang aa na shya bha'i tshigs bcad kyis bsdus pa las bzhi po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yang /
translated: In order to understand those four, the four are also summarized by the verse of the four aṃśas.

original: rdo rje rab gnas rdo rje ni //
analyzed: rdo rje rab gnas rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajra is well-ascertained by the vajra.

original: che dang dril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: che dang dril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The great and bell and so forth.

original: 'dis ni tshigs bcad bzhi'i rjes su rim pas slob dpon dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang bzhi po rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshigs bcad bzhi'i rjes su rim pas slob dpon dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang bzhi po rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the four empowerments in order, following the four verses, namely the master empowerment, the secret empowerment, the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, and the fourth empowerment.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las yang de rnams ji ltar cho ga rgyas par dkyil 'khor gyi thabs legs par bsdu bar btus pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las yang de rnams ji ltar cho ga rgyas par dkyil 'khor gyi thabs legs par bsdu bar btus pa'o //
translated: And in the explanatory tantra, they are well summarized in the mandala ritual as an extensive procedure.

original: de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis legs par bsdu ba nyid du bcal bar bya ste de bas na 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba rnams kyis legs par bsdu ba nyid du bcal bar bya ste de bas na 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: Those who seek that should look for the good summary, and therefore it is not explained here.

original: gsang ba la sogs pa zin par bya ba la yan lag gnyis byin gyis brlab ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsang ba la sogs pa zin par bya ba la yan lag gnyis byin gyis brlab ba gsungs pa /
translated: In order to grasp the secret and so forth, the consecration of the two branches is taught.

original: aom padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om padma, and so forth.

original: de ni rgyud kyi rgyal po yang yin la chen po yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rgyud kyi rgyal po yang yin la chen po yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the king of tantras and also great.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po ste /
translated: The great king of tantras.

original: sgyu ma'i brtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan kye'i rdo rje zhes bya ba 'bum phrag lnga pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i brtag pa zhes bya ba gzhan kye'i rdo rje zhes bya ba 'bum phrag lnga pa /
translated: The “Examination of Illusion” is another name for the Hevajra Tantra in 500,000 verses.

original: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba /
analyzed: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba /
translated: It is extracted from the “Examination of the Thirty-Two.”

original: brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal @58b po chen po'o //
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal @58b po chen po'o //
translated: It is the great king of tantras, Hevajra, which has the nature of the two examinations.

original: slob dpon chen po mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las khyad par mang po dang bcas pa'i bsdu ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po sgyu ma'i brtag pa /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa koo mu di zhes bya ba'i dka' 'grel las khyad par mang po dang bcas pa'i bsdu ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po sgyu ma'i brtag pa /
translated: The great master scholar Śrī Jayabhadra composed the commentary called the Ko’umudi, which contains many special points on the great king of tantras, the “Examination of Illusion,”

original: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las byung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po kye'i rdo rje las le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las byung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po kye'i rdo rje las le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: which is extracted from the “Examination of the Thirty-Two” and is the great king of tantras, Hevajra, which has the nature of the two examinations.

original: // / lha mo rgyud stong snying po'i grangs kyi rtsom pa sa la dang po'i ri mo ni /
analyzed: // / lha mo rgyud stong snying po'i grangs kyi rtsom pa sa la dang po'i ri mo ni /
translated: The first painting of the “Goddess Tantra, the Heart of the Thousand”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chen po'i chen po kye'i rdo rje koo mu di'i dka' 'grel 'di //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chen po'i chen po kye'i rdo rje koo mu di'i dka' 'grel 'di //
translated: This commentary on the great of the great Bhagavān’s Hevajra, the Koṭāli,

original: mtha' yas rgyud kyi rtsa bar gyur pa bdag gis byas pas bsod nams gang bsgrubs pa //
analyzed: mtha' yas rgyud kyi rtsa bar gyur pa bdag gis byas pas bsod nams gang bsgrubs pa //
translated: By me, the root of the infinite tantra, whatever merit is accomplished,🔽By that, may this assembly of other beings definitely realize the meaning of that king of tantras.

original: des ni nges par skye bo gzhan tshogs 'di dag rgyud rgyal de yi don rtogs shog / thos pa'i ston ka byung ba'i dpal //
analyzed: des ni nges par skye bo gzhan tshogs 'di dag rgyud rgyal de yi don rtogs shog / thos pa'i ston ka byung ba'i dpal //
translated: The glory of the autumn of hearing,

original: sbyang dka'i zla ba koo mu di //
analyzed: sbyang dka'i zla ba koo mu di //
translated: The moon of the difficult to purify Koṭāli,

original: mkhas pa'i tsa kor tshogs kyis ni //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tsa kor tshogs kyis ni //
translated: By the assembly of the circle of the wise,

original: bsod nams 'di ni btung bar mdzod //
analyzed: bsod nams 'di ni btung bar mdzod //
translated: Drink this nectar of merit.

original: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi dka' 'grel koo mu di zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhas pa dpal sbyang dka' ba'i zla bas mdzad pa dpal kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi dka' 'grel koo mu di zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the difficult points of the glorious Hevajra Tantra composed by the glorious scholar Dānaśrī, the Koṭāli, is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a ai nta ru tsi ra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a ai nta ru tsi ra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur pa'o//
translated: By the Indian preceptor Prajñā-indraruci and the translator-monk Śākya-ye-she.
